Articles.Content:
Ok, before anyone satrs accusing me of being too politicly correct, I must say that it just doesn't stand. Besides, I completely like the idea of kerbals being of no ***. But it just isn't so, considering e.g. thst Von Herman or whatever his name his in the sci building. He has mustache, and that is a obvious masculine trait. And no, it cannot be a sexless kerbal

with mustaches, because it is a human masculine trait.

The thing is, I really love this game and this, but believe it or not, in this state it is sexist, even if unintended. And please,

don't put them in pink dresses or give em make up, just a nice subtle approach to this issue would be nice.
Who says Mustaches are only trait of Male Kerbals? Anyway tons of these threads exist and the devs surely took notice. Please read the "What not to suggest" thread next time.
Oh lawd, another thread on this. It's been suggested a lot... but why exactly can't a sexless species have mustaches?

Dangerously close to a "what not to suggest". But anyway, while the thread hasn't been given the blue-screw-glue treatment yet, I'll ask: What about Warhammer orks?

Obviously masculine by any human definition. They are however, sexless, reproducing by spores. You kill an ork, you will soon have many more orks.

I still think Kerbals are a branch from the same evolutionary tree as orks, myself.

Jimmy Jazz, Squad are leaving female kerbals to a later stage of development when they have the time and resources to do it properly, please understand that KSP is not finished, it is in heavy development and many features are not complete yet.

Closing!
